name: Chapter 2: Benefits of Cloud Computing
description: Flashcards highlighting the key business and operational advantages of cloud computing using pizza shop metaphors.

cards.front: You're starting a new app and want to avoid large capital investments in servers. What cloud benefit addresses this concern?
cards.back: Trading upfront expense for variable expense allows you to pay only for what you use, avoiding the cost of purchasing and maintaining infrastructure upfront.
cards.example: Instead of buying racks of servers, a startup launches on AWS and pays per hour of EC2 usage.
cards.mnemonic: Why buy the whole oven when you can pay per pizza?
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.term: Trade upfront expense for variable expense
glossary.definition: Pay only for what you use in the cloud, rather than making large capital investments in infrastructure.

cards.front: You're tired of managing physical infrastructure and want to focus on application development. What cloud advantage helps with this?
cards.back: Stop spending money to run and maintain data centers. With cloud, providers manage the infrastructure so you can focus on your applications.
cards.example: A company moves to AWS to avoid maintaining its cooling systems, servers, and generators.
cards.mnemonic: Stop fixing fridges. Start making sauce.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.term: Stop spending money to run and maintain data centers
glossary.definition: Reduce costs and operational overhead by using managed infrastructure in the cloud.

cards.front: Your app has unpredictable traffic—some days high, some low. What cloud feature lets you adjust without overpaying?
cards.back: Stop guessing capacity. Cloud services scale automatically up or down, letting you match resources to actual usage.
cards.example: A ticketing website handles spikes during a concert sale by scaling EC2 instances via Auto Scaling.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: Scale resources as needed to meet real-time demand using cloud elasticity.

cards.front: How does cloud computing help small businesses reduce costs on infrastructure purchases?
cards.back: Benefit from massive economies of scale. Cloud providers aggregate usage across millions, lowering costs passed on to customers.
cards.example: A small developer gets enterprise-grade storage pricing through AWS’s large-scale infrastructure deals.
cards.mnemonic: Big baker buys = better deals for small pizza shops.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.term: Benefit from massive economies of scale
glossary.definition: Cloud providers reduce per-unit infrastructure cost through bulk operations.

cards.front: You want to test and deploy new features quickly. What benefit of the cloud helps you do that?
cards.back: Increase speed and agility. The cloud allows rapid provisioning of resources, enabling faster development, testing, and deployment.
cards.example: A developer launches a new backend test in AWS Lambda within minutes of writing the function.
cards.mnemonic: From garlic idea to garlic crust—tonight.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: Cloud services allow quick resource provisioning, accelerating innovation and time to market.

cards.front: You want to deploy an app to users in different continents with low latency. What cloud benefit enables this?
cards.back: Go global in minutes. AWS’s global infrastructure lets you deploy applications close to users, improving performance.
cards.example: A media company uses CloudFront and multiple AWS Regions to stream content to users in Asia and North America with low latency.
cards.mnemonic: One dough, two continents, zero delay.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates
